update.description:
Built on top of pull request #114 and pull request #117 \(which depends on ign-physics [pull request #46](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/46)\). It’s probably best to review these first.

Added an altimeter system. Given that it is still unclear how we’re going to integrate sensors, I decided to implement the altimeter inside the system without depending on ign-sensors. This also means that the current implementation does not support setting noise or update rate. We can move to ign-sensors later if needed.

I also added the following new components:

* Altimeter
* WorldPose
* WorldLinearVelocity

Let me know if I should put the World\* components in separate files - currently I just put them in Pose.hh and LinearVelocity.hh.

‌

To test, run:

    ign-gazebo -v 4 -f examples/worlds/altimeter_sensor.sdf

In another terminal, echo the `/altimeter` topic

    ign topic -e -t /altimeter

Hit play to start simulation and see altimeter data printed in the terminal
update.title: Add Altimeter system

content.html:
How about making this not specific to the altimeter? Instead, the physics will update the world pose and world velocity for any entities which have these components. Something like this:

  _ecm.Each<components::Pose, components::WorldPose,
           components::ParentEntity>(
      [&](const Entity &/*_entity*/, components::WorldPose *_worldPose,
          components::ParentEntity *_parent)->bool
      {
        // Find entity or parent in one of the maps

        // Set world pose

        return true;
      });

  _ecm.Each<components::Pose, components::WorldLinearVelocity,
           components::ParentEntity>(
      [&](const Entity &/*_entity*/, components::WorldLinearVelocity *_worldPose,
          components::ParentEntity *_parent)->bool
      {
        // Find entity or parent in one of the maps

        // Set world velocity

        return true;
      });

content.raw: Creating entities may be better at `PreUpdate` so physics can update the values on the same iteration.
content.html: Creating entities may be better at PreUpdate so physics can update the values on the same iteration.

content.raw: I think this can be called to the `PostUpdate` callback, so you publish the latest data after the physics update
content.html: I think this can be called to the PostUpdate callback, so you publish the latest data after the physics update

content.raw: You shouldn't need `Pose` and `ParentEntity` here either
content.html: You shouldn't need Pose and ParentEntity here either

content.raw: This looks like a good function to go into a more generic header that can be reused by other systems.
content.html: This looks like a good function to go into a more generic header that can be reused by other systems.

content.raw: Do you need the `worldPose` variable? Couldn't you do `pose = pose + parentPose...`?
content.html: Do you need the worldPose variable? Couldn't you do pose = pose + parentPose...?

content.raw: It looks like you can remove the `Pose` and `ParentEntity` components from this `Each` call
content.html: It looks like you can remove the Pose and ParentEntity components from this Each call

content.raw: If the `Configure` function won't be used, you can remove this interface.
content.html: If the Configure function won't be used, you can remove this interface.

content.raw:
Should we have a default topic? Or print an error if the topic is not defined?

The default could be something like this to follow the pattern we've been using: `/model/<model_name>/sensor/<sensor_name>/altimeter`
content.html:
Should we have a default topic? Or print an error if the topic is not defined?

The default could be something like this to follow the pattern we've been using: /model/<model_name>/sensor/<sensor_name>/altimeter

content.raw:
> Physics shouldn’t set explicitly the Altimeter data

yep noted in the comments. I could not find an easy way to compute the world linear velocity of a point relative to a link inside the sensors system. Ideas welcome.

> Can we guaranteed that all sensors can be updated at the same time with the same data?

To add to what @chapulina said, I think there was a discussion about adding the ability to set the update rate of an ign-gazebo system in the future
content.html:
Physics shouldn’t set explicitly the Altimeter data

yep noted in the comments. I could not find an easy way to compute the world linear velocity of a point relative to a link inside the sensors system. Ideas welcome.

Can we guaranteed that all sensors can be updated at the same time with the same data?

To add to what @chapulina said, I think there was a discussion about adding the ability to set the update rate of an ign-gazebo system in the future

content.raw:
> Is it possible to contribute ign-gazebo systems from another repository? Then ign-sensors could be a collection of systems.

Yes, systems are just plugins, so they can come from other libraries, but the library will need to depend on `ign-gazebo`. In the case of sensors, we would like `ign-gazebo` to ship with several default sensors by default, so we would need to find a way to ship those together. But the main point of `ign-sensors` originally was for it to be a gazebo-independent library, and adding this dependency would invalidate that.

> Can we guaranteed that all sensors can be updated at the same time with the same data?

Yes, all systems are being updated at the same time with the same data. We currently don't have a way to configure the update rate of each system though, so they're all running at the maximum rate.

> We can then convert ign-sensors to a group of classes that are used in ign-gazebo’s systems.

Yes, I think this could be a way to integrate it. I'd be curious to see what kind of interfaces that class would expose to `ign-gazebo`, maybe it's worth it making a quick proof of concept implementation to compare with this PR.

> SDF processing should be done in ign-gazebo or in ign-sensors?

`ign-gazebo` will do it no matter what. It can forward it to `ign-sensors` if needed, like it currently does with `ign-physics`.

> the function of ignition sensors should be to modify and expose sensor data coming from the simulation simulating real life sensors

Yes, I agree with that pull request. We just need to figure out the best place to draw a line between what goes in `ign-sensors` and what goes here.

---

Not sure if you've seen [this discussion](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/114/wip-camera-sensors/diff#comment-87119446). Feel free to add comments there if you see fit.
content.html:
Is it possible to contribute ign-gazebo systems from another repository? Then ign-sensors could be a collection of systems.

Yes, systems are just plugins, so they can come from other libraries, but the library will need to depend on ign-gazebo. In the case of sensors, we would like ign-gazebo to ship with several default sensors by default, so we would need to find a way to ship those together. But the main point of ign-sensors originally was for it to be a gazebo-independent library, and adding this dependency would invalidate that.

Can we guaranteed that all sensors can be updated at the same time with the same data?

Yes, all systems are being updated at the same time with the same data. We currently don't have a way to configure the update rate of each system though, so they're all running at the maximum rate.

We can then convert ign-sensors to a group of classes that are used in ign-gazebo’s systems.

Yes, I think this could be a way to integrate it. I'd be curious to see what kind of interfaces that class would expose to ign-gazebo, maybe it's worth it making a quick proof of concept implementation to compare with this PR.

SDF processing should be done in ign-gazebo or in ign-sensors?

ign-gazebo will do it no matter what. It can forward it to ign-sensors if needed, like it currently does with ign-physics.

the function of ignition sensors should be to modify and expose sensor data coming from the simulation simulating real life sensors

Yes, I agree with that pull request. We just need to figure out the best place to draw a line between what goes in ign-sensors and what goes here.

Not sure if you've seen this discussion. Feel free to add comments there if you see fit.

content.raw:
Some questions and observations:

* Is it possible to contribute ign-gazebo systems from another repository? Then ign-sensors could be a collection of systems.
* SensorManager is not being used… Can we guaranteed that all sensors can be updated at the same time with the same data? If so, I am fine without a sensor manager, IMHO. We can then convert ign-sensors to a group of classes that are used in ign-gazebo’s systems. In that case we would need to move the specifics implementation methods there, leaving the definition of the systems here. If not we have the risk of re implement everything inside of ign-gazebo. This options is not mutually excluded with the previous one. We can have the ign-gazebo’s systems defined in ign-sensors, but the sensor implementation are inside their own classes and could be used without ign-gazebo’s systems.
* Physics shouldn’t set explicitly the Altimeter data as Ian commented here. Sensor manager could be the one updating the components used by each sensor… Or maybe simulation runner should be on charge of that? In theory something should update the components used by each system, it doesn’t matter if it is a sensor or not.
* SDF processing should be done in ign-gazebo or in ign-sensors? I think that depends how we eventually want to define sensors modifiers.

I would say that the function of ignition sensors should be to modify and expose sensor data coming from the simulation simulating real life sensors. I think that modifiers as noise, update rate changes, delays, etc, should be implemented in that library. If the raw data is going to go through ign-gazebo or not it should be defined on how physics and rendering expose that information.
content.html:
Some questions and observations:

  • Is it possible to contribute ign-gazebo systems from another repository? Then ign-sensors could be a collection of systems.
  • SensorManager is not being used… Can we guaranteed that all sensors can be updated at the same time with the same data? If so, I am fine without a sensor manager, IMHO. We can then convert ign-sensors to a group of classes that are used in ign-gazebo’s systems. In that case we would need to move the specifics implementation methods there, leaving the definition of the systems here. If not we have the risk of re implement everything inside of ign-gazebo. This options is not mutually excluded with the previous one. We can have the ign-gazebo’s systems defined in ign-sensors, but the sensor implementation are inside their own classes and could be used without ign-gazebo’s systems.
  • Physics shouldn’t set explicitly the Altimeter data as Ian commented here. Sensor manager could be the one updating the components used by each sensor… Or maybe simulation runner should be on charge of that? In theory something should update the components used by each system, it doesn’t matter if it is a sensor or not.
  • SDF processing should be done in ign-gazebo or in ign-sensors? I think that depends how we eventually want to define sensors modifiers.

I would say that the function of ignition sensors should be to modify and expose sensor data coming from the simulation simulating real life sensors. I think that modifiers as noise, update rate changes, delays, etc, should be implemented in that library. If the raw data is going to go through ign-gazebo or not it should be defined on how physics and rendering expose that information.
